newsitem.title: FRANCE: TNT turns to ferries after tunnel fire.
newsitem.headline: TNT turns to ferries after tunnel fire.

text.p: TNT Express Worldwide said it was relying more on ferry transport for its cross-channel trucking service following the suspension of Eurotunnel Plc/SA's freight shuttles as a result of Monday night's fire.

"On average we operate around 40 trucking departures per day from the U.K. to the Continent, the vast majority of traffic via the Channel Tunnel. However, since the fire we have turned to the ferries as back-up," a London-based TNT spokesman told Reuters.
The switch was working smoothly enough as TNT already transported a small quantity of traffic by ferry on a regular basis as part of its cross-Channel trucking operation.
In addition to the ferries, TNT would resort to air transport as back-up if customers requested it., the spokesman said.

"Clearly, we hope the freight shuttle services will be resumed as soon as possible and Eurotunnel has informed us they are intend to squeeze as much usage as possible out of the tunnel still in service so it's really wait-and-see for the moment."
